text: Hi all, I am trying to build a membership site and i cant figure out how to make a signup template any idea on how to do this? is there any tutorial for membership sites available?

We don’t right now have a full tutorial on how to create one but we do have examples.

The basic jist though is that you need to use `membership_register_page` as the template type, and include the member register tag.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates#membership-register>

In our boilerplate we have an example registration page template you can base yours off of.
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/templates/system/membership-register.html>
I went through the whole documentation and cound not find anything on hiw to actually make a signup form. I am really lost o be honest on how to approach this problem

You can use the register tag, OR just make a normal HubSpot form. The way memberships works in HubSpot is that the contact needs to be added to a list, that list is what’s given access to membership protected pages.

So if you set up a normal form to add a user to that list, they will become registered, and able to view the page.
And what about the registered member password? So he can login to se his user dashboard?
When he is added to the list it has just the email but cant find how the user can set a password
The email the user receives should take them to a page to set their password
Hmm maybe im not geting an email because im testing on the sandbox? Does that make sense?
Sandboxes are limited in their ability to send emails (to prevent malicious use of sandboxes)
